loans.use: To buy six sacks of fertilizer and pay for harvesting of her farmland.

loans.name: Cay

texts.en: Cay is requesting a new loan to buy new furniture, bowls, chopsticks and food to satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and to earn a higher income to support her family. Cay hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new furniture, bowls, chopsticks and food

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is a 43-year-old married woman with two sons. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Yen helps her family by running a business which sells bread with small pieces of pork and sausages. 

She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing food and good quality ingredients at wholesale prices. Yen hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and good quality ingredients at wholesale prices

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 51 years old and is married with two daughters. She and her husband support their family by selling noodles in the local community. 

Thu would like to take out a loan to increase the working capital for her business so she can buy better quality food such as meat, noodles and other ingredients to sell at higher margins. Thu hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy better quality food such as meat, noodles and other ingredients

loans.name: Knox

texts.en:
Knox is a 50-year-old clergy member. He is married and has two kids. In 2003, Knox established a social welfare group out of the need to offer financial literacy and solutions to his congregation, which is composed of rural disadvantaged families. Through this social welfare group, Knox would arrange for seminars and field days through which his congregation would be trained on how to save and on good farming practices. The same members would also pool their savings together and offer some short-term loans to some of their members to repay with a small amount of interest. 

In 2005, Knox registered his group as a microfinance and consulting institution named Rural Economic Empowerment Programme (REEP). He hoped to mobilise savings from the church members and advance loans to the less fortunate in the church by facilitating them to pay school fees, buy farm inputs, buy water harvesting tanks and improve their general living standards. REEP grew within a few years and Knox recruited members from other denominations and also expanded to other towns because of the good advocacy the institution was getting through its members. Today, REEP has enrolled over 400 groups and has a network presence in central, eastern, and coastal Kenya. 

In response to the high cost of kerosene for lighting the members' households, REEP introduced solar lanterns from BrazAfric to its members by financing the members to buy these solar lamps. The demand for the solar lamps soon became too high, so REEP, due to limited cash flow, could not buy an adequate supply of solar lamps to meet the high demand. Knox has been enjoying some credit terms to pay for the lamps in 30 days. He is now seeking to purchase solar lamps worth $2,000 for his members through Kiva financing. 

On the uploaded photo is Knox with Sera- a member of one of his group called St Anne's Self help group in Voi, who purchased a solar lantern on loan from REEP. She has since finished repaying for the solar lamp and no longer has to spend so much money on buying Kerosene but rather she is happy that she can save now some extra money for food and school fees.

loans.use: to pay for solar lanterns

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying more clothes from different suppliers to satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and to earn a higher income to support her family. 

Hiep hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Phung

texts.en:
Phung is requesting a new loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, shampoo, dyes and nail polish. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Phung hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, shampoo, dyes and nail polish

loans.name: Quan

texts.en:
Quan is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of clothes to better satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and to earn a higher income to support her family. 

Quan hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 29 years old, married with two children and lives in the Philippines. 
Julieta makes and sells snacks in her village such as hot cake and rice cake. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients like sugar, flour, cheese and rice for making snacks.
Julieta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future,Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Sreynin

texts.en:
Sreynin, aged 26, is married and is the mother of one child. With her three-member family, she lives in a rural area located in Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal Province, Cambodia. In order to generate daily income for their basic household necessities especially for their child, both Sreynin and her husband have been working at the garment factory for one year. 

Sreynin has never been with Kiva partner, VisionFund, before. As a first-time borrower, she is seeking a loan to buy house construction materials including cement, steel, sand, roof, etc. A portion of the loan will be used to pay for the labor cost for house construction. She hopes to own a new solid house for her family instead of using the money to fix an old house. Then Sreynin can pay more attention to generating more income in order to support her child.

loans.use: To buy construction materials and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been effectively doing business in the clothing trade for the last four years. Her collection is very famous in her town. She offers variety of clothes in different colors for her customers and makes enough to lead a decent life.
She is a loving mother of three daughters and two sons. She is in charge of providing her family with good food, keeping them healthy, and supporting their education. She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 35,000/- to buy more clothes in various designs and different colors. She hopes to have more profits and hence better support her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Vanna is married and the mother of one child under school age. She is a resident of the Kror Kor District of Pursat Province (Cambodia). It is the area where rice farming is a common business. Vanna manages one hectare of farmland with assistance from her husband, growing paddy rice as their primary source of income.To increase the family's income, she also raises pigs at home while her husband sells his own produced rice wine. The main challenge for her family is the drought that made crop yields decline. Vanna's group is composed of three female members taking out a new loan and she is the group leader. She and one of the members are second loan cycle clients while the remaining member is a first loan cycle client. The past loans which she has repaid have helped her to manage her business. She will use her loan portion to buy three sacks of fertilizer for her farmland and feed for her pig-raising business. She hopes that her business will grow as well as she expects so as to earn more income to buy a mini-tractor to support her rice farming business.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizer for her farmland and feed for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Tiburcio

texts.es: Tiburcio, es una persona de 58 años de edad, vive en su casa propia, de estado civil casado, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, y cuenta con una sola dependiente económica a cargo la cual es su hija. La actividad económica del cliente y su esposa es netamente la producción agrícola y los principales productos que cultiva y comercializa son la papa, haba, arveja, cebada y maíz; la siembra de estos cultivos los realiza en sus propias parcelas que se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Payco Mayu Bajo del municipio de Tíraque que esta distante aproximadamente a unos 65 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. El señor Marín y su esposa manifiestan ser personas trabajadores y responsables que quieren superarse e incrementar su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de abono de gallinaza y semilla de papa y de tal forma obtener mayor productividad y a través de ello mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Tiburcio is a man of 58. He is married, and lives in his own house. He went to school as far as primary, and has one dependent: his daughter.

The livelihood of the client and his wife is clearly farming and the main products he grows and sells are potatoes, lima beans, peas, barley and corn. He plants these crops on his own parcels of land which are located in the community of Payco Mayu Bajo in the municipality of Tíraque, which is approximately 65 km from the city of Cochabamba. 

Tiburcio and his wife say they are hard-working and responsible people who wish to improve themselves and increase their agricultural production. To that end, they see the need to apply for investment capital, in order to purchase chicken manure and potato seed. In this way they can get greater productivity and thereby improve their family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy chicken manure and potato seeds.

loans.name: Sek's Group

texts.en: Sek is 43 years old and originally from the Kror Kor District of Pursat Province. She has nine children. Seven of her children are still living with her and three of them are paid workers. The other children are still in school, helping the family's business, or under school age. To meet the daily basic needs for her big household, she has been working as a rice farmer for three years as the main source of income. Her husband works for others for a fee and also sells his handmade sugar palm. From the current business, she is able to earn about 13,000 KHR per day. Sek has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and completely repaid her loans. The past two loans have made a better living for her family. She has formed a group of three female members to seek a new loan. She and one of her group members are seeking for 500,000 KHR each while the remaining member is applying for 700,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for harvesting costs. She hopes that this loan will assist her during this harvesting season so as to receive a larger yield and make more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay harvesting fees.

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.en: Cipriano is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. Cipriano  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages.He had this business for eight years.He requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Cipriano has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future,Cipriano hopes to improve his business for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Rosalina became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Rosalina hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to increase her stocs of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Bou's Group

texts.en:
Bou, aged 53, lives in a rural area of Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She is the mother of three children and has to provide for the two who are still in school. Bou has been a farmer on one hectare of farmland for 30 years where she grows paddy rice and can earn approximately 4.5 US dollars per day. Her husband also helps to earn more income for the family through working as a chief for wedding and religious ceremonies.

Bou's group consists of three female members: she and one of her co-members are third-time borrowers while the remaining group member is a second-time borrower. From the previous loans which she has repaid, Bou has been able to grow her cash crop in a timely fashion with a good yield.

Now, she feels confident in improving her family's standard of living to a good level especially for her children. Therefore, Bou is leading this group to seek a new loan. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, to pay for harvesting costs, and will use the remainder to purchase school materials for her children. Bou hopes to double her income from the current business and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, to pay for harvesting costs, and to purchase school materials for her children

loans.name: Korn

texts.en:
Korn, 39, is a widowed mother of three dependent daughters who are still in school. As a single mother, to bear her family's hardship, she has been growing paddy rice as the main source of income, supplementing her income by selling chickens and purchasing recycling waste. She has been operating these businesses for 17 years and they earn her about 19,000 KHR. 

Korn has borrowed from VisionFund four times. After these successful loans which have helped her to maintain her household and keep her children in school, she is now seeking a new loan of 2,500,000 KHR. Korn will use this loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her rice field and will use a portion of it to buy more chickens to sell. She hopes to earn more income, so she can support her children's education to university level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her rice field, and to buy more chickens to sell.

loans.name: Nueva Generacion - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento NUEVA GENERACION - 26,  Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Oliette tiene 38 años casada con tres hijos que son de las edades de 12, 19 y 23 años, los tres estudiando,  La Sra. Oliette se dedica  a la venta de ropa según la temporada, ella tiene un puesto fijo por la zona de Llojeta  de la ciudad de La Paz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su quinta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Oliette va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de ropa de temporada por mayor como ser chompas y chamarras para combatir esta época de invierno y de esta manera brindar variedad de ropa  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Oliette va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de ropa según la temporada, la Sra. Oliette es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Generación-26" communal bank is made up of eight members: six women and two men. The chairperson of the bank is Oliette. She is 38, married, and has three children, ages 12, 19 and 23. All three go to school. 

Oliette sells clothing according to the season. She has a permanent stand in the Llojeta area of the city of La Paz,  where she sells her products. This is her fifth loan with the institution. 

Oliette is going to use this loan for the purchase of seasonal clothing at wholesale, such as sweaters and jackets to combat this winter season. This way she can offer a variety of clothing to her clientele and increase her earnings. Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. 

Oliette is going to use the profits to continue buying a variety of clothing according to the season. Oliette is a very hard-working person, who feels happy because of the opportunity offered to her and her fellow group members, as in some cases they support their families on their own.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing at wholesale, such as sweaters and jackets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables for a vegetable-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farming inputs.

loans.name: Aguinini A Group

texts.fr: Marié à une revendeuse, Mr yaya  est père de 05 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. L’ainé a 19ans et le dernier 02ans. Il fait partie d’un groupement qui a pour nom « AGUININI A » dont il est le responsable. Ils sont tous dans le domaine de l’agriculture et cela leur procure des revenus considérables pouvant leur permettre de prendre soin de leur famille. Vu qu’il a une superficie énorme, il sollicite l’aide de WAGES par son premier prêt afin de s’approvisionner en outils de travail pour avoir un bon rendement. Il veut devenir un grand producteur dans la REGION CENTRALE (lieu ou toute son activité se déroule), subvenir aux besoins de la famille sur tous les plans. Notons que 03 personnes lui prêtent main forte pour l’avancement de son activité et qu’il est dans ce domaine il ya 03ans.
texts.en:
Married to a reseller, Yaya is the father of five children, two of whom go to school.  His oldest child is 19 years old; the youngest is 2.

Yaya is the leading member of a group called "AGUININI A".  All the members of the group work in farming and this activity brings them a good income, which allows them to take care of their families.

Given the large area of Yaya's cultivable land, he is requesting the assistance of WAGES for his first loan.  This loan will be used to purchase the farming tools necessary to obtain a good yield.

Yaya wants to become an important producer in the Central Region (where all his farming activity is based) and take care of all his family needs.

It should be noted that three people help him with his business, and that he has been involved in this activity for the past three years.

loans.use: to buy farming tools.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 28 años, su pareja es Juan, con quien tiene cinco hijos de 13, 11, 7, 3 y 1 año de edad. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde niña, pero desde que se unió a su pareja, trabaja arduamente con la producción de frutas cítricas de todas las variedades; “la ventaja de cultivar cítricos es que todo el año puede producir, dependiendo en qué mes se siembre”, menciona.
Cuando no hay mucho que hacer en sus tierras, ella y Juan trabajan en otras tierras donde les pagan al día. Además cuando ellos requieren mano de obra también tienen que contratar más personal. Celia todavía sigue cosechando sus frutos, pero afirma que en los meses de setiembre y octubre los precios son más favorables, por ello tienen árboles disponibles que producirán esos meses. Por ahora se esmera en la limpieza de sus cultivos.

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP y da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Además, forma parte del banco comunal “Flor de Almendra”, donde tiene socios cuyos intereses son los mismos. Se siente a gusto con el trabajo.
Celia invertirá este dinero en la compra de fertilizantes, cuyas bolsas cuestan de 95 a 110 soles cada una. Lo restante será para el pago del personal que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Celia is 28 years old and with her partner, Juan, she has five children of 13, 11, 7, 3 and 1 years of age. They all live together in their own house in a native community in the Selva Central. 

She has been working in agriculture since she was a little girl. But since she is with her partner, she works hard in the production of all sorts of citrus fruits. “The advantage of growing citrus fruits is that you can produce them year round, depending on the month you seed them”, she says.
When there is not a lot to do in their fields, Celia and Juan work as day laborer on other fields. 

They also hire people when they require more labor. Celia continues to harvest her fruits but says that the prices are more favorable in the months of September and October. Therefore, they also have spare trees that will bear fruit in these months. Currently, they are working hard to clean their cultivation. 

This is their fourth credit with MFP and they promise to pay the monthly installments on time. 

Furthermore, they are part of the community bank “Flor de Almendra”. There, they have partners with similar interests. They feel comfortable with their work. 

Celia will invest this money to buy fertilizers of which each bag costs 95 to 110 soles. The rest, she will use to pay the staff she will hire to clean the cultivation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay the staff she will hire to clean the cultivation.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Living in a thatched house together with seven children, Phalla is married and a 49-year-old mother. Three of her children are still in school and some of her remaining four children are helping the family business while the others are paid workers in Phnom Penh (Capital city of Cambodia). She has been rice cropping on three hectares of farmland and raises three pigs while her husband works elsewhere locally and uses his spare time to help her in the rice field. Having this business for 27 years, she is able to earn about 16,000 Cambodia Riel (KHR) per day. The main challenge for her is the lack of water supply for her rice field. She is a three-time borrower. She has successfully used her past two loans with in supporting her rice farming business. Now, she is taking out a new loan in the amount of 2,500,000 KHR to buy an additional plot of farmland to grow more rice. She expects to gain more yields so as to make more profit and improve living standards for her family.

loans.use: To buy an additional plot of farmland to grow more rice.

loans.name: Gulbakhor

texts.en: You have never seen such wonderful national Tajik women dresses such as the ones sewed by Gulbakhor. She is a 21-years old woman who is not married. She has ‘golden hands’ and sews very wonderful dresses. This perfect person wants to organize her own business deal. She studied a the course titled: ‘How to get success’ and got some skills for conducting business. If she can organize her business, she will improve her living condition using the profit. She is asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine and fabrics. She promises to make her payment on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy pots for food making business.

loans.name: Gulzeby

texts.en: Gulzeby is widow and has six children. She is 59-years old. All of her children are adults. She always wanted to provide them with a good quality of life. Her children have jobs, but Gulzeby decided to start a new business of rope selling in order to generate an income that she can use to help her children improve their living conditions.  If you will help her with money, she will buy different kind of ropes to sell. She studied in a course called: ‘How to get success’ through a women's organization and got enough skills about business. Her grandchildren will help her with the business. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 1800 Somoni for organizing the new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy ropes for organizing new business

loans.name: Chhen's Group

texts.en: Chhen, a 48-year-old mother, is a rural villager from the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. She has four children; three (two daughters and one son) of whom are students at the local public school and the remaining  son is working for others for a fee. She manages to grow paddy rice on two and half hectares of farmland for the last 17 years and has been able to earn about 15,000 KHR per day. To add to her income, her husband not only helps her in the rice field, but also raises pigs at home and works for others for a pay. However, sometimes she gets low crop yield due to the drought and the lack of working capital; it is the main challenge that she has encountered. To overcome this challenge, she now leads a group of two to seek a new loan. This is her third loan cycle, and the first loan cycle for her member. She is applying for 1,300,000 KHR and her co-member is applying for 200,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy more piglets for raising and build a pigpen.  She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a high price in order to make a better living condition for her big family.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for raising and to make a pigpen.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is 33-years old, and is from the city of Mombasa. She is married and the mother of three children that are her dependents. Fatuma makes a living selling milk at the market. This has been her first business, which she receives the support of her husband. Her husband works in a private business and contributes to the household expenses with his earnings. She hopes to diversify her products with the objective of satisfying her customers' needs. She is requesting the loan to buy more milk for sale. Her next goals are to have more varied products, grow in sales to receive greater earnings for her family, and to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy more milk for sale.

loans.name: Foday

texts.en: This is 40 year old Foday.  He is married, and has two children aged 15 & 18 years old.  He has five additional dependents living with him.  In 2002, Foday established his sand business. He began his business because he want his life to be comfortable with his family. Working sven days-a-week for 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Foday now requires a  loan in order to buy a YAHAMA 2000 horse power engine to be used in the boat that he uses to transport the sand from one location to another by sea. In the future, Foday plans to erect another house, build more boats, and get more profits.  He is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: to improve his business.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Osman.  He is married and has two children aged ten and three. In 1992, Osman established his palm oil and garri (cassava flakes) business. He began his business in order for him to be able to take care of his family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 700,000 every month as profit from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of  Le 3,000,000. Osman requires a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil and bags of garri in large quantity. In the future, Osman plans to construct a shop and a house so that his wife can manage the shop. He is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil and bags of garri.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en: Salomat is 39-years old. She is married and has four children. She is very industrious and clever. She has a 3.50 ha land and grows maize and wheat. Her children help her with business. Salomat must work hard as her children become older and demand more money. She is going to start a new business with animal husbandry in order to generate additional income for improving her living condition. She is asking for a loan of 1000 somoni to buy cows. In this way, she will provide her family with s high quality living condition. Moreover, she will enter her children in good schools. She promises to make her payment on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cows for organizing new business

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor is 43-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Eleanor is providing habal-habal or motorcycle services as her husband is the driver. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to pay for the maintenance.
Eleanor has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Eleanor hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en: Marie Rose is 30 years old. She is married and has two children. She owns a bar where she sells beer and soft drinks. With the loan, she wants to add more beer and sodas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Innocente

texts.en: Innocente is 31 years old. She is married and has two children. She sells rice, soaps and salt. With the loan, she wants to add more items in the boutique. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings for the better future of her business.

loans.use: To buy more soaps and salt to sell.

loans.name: Domithille

texts.en: Domithille is 25 years old. She is married and has three children. Domithille sells spare parts for motorbikes, and has been in that business for 2 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more spare parts to sell. She plans to use the profits from the business to build her house.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Nchanze

texts.en:
Nchanze is from the town of Likoni, Kenya. She is 39 years old, married and has two school-going children. 

She owns and operates a small space for her fish vending. She is also planning to have a general store to serve customers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 KES a month.

In 2011, Nchanze joined Yehu to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more fish and cooking oil. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Revendeuse de dessous féminins et pour enfant dans un marché de la place, Abla mère de 03 enfants tous scolarisés âgés de 13, 11 et 06ans est âgée de 42ans  qui est mariée à un sérigraphe. Elle vend de jolis sous vêtements à toutes personnes c’est pour cela son stock s’épuise à chaque fois qu’elle s’approvisionne. Sa clientèle s’élargit de plus en plus et elle n’arrive pas à couvrir leurs demandes c’est pour cela elle sollicite de notre institution un second prêt pour s’approvisionner en marchandises. Elle veut agrandir son stock, avoir tous les nouveautés possibles pour pouvoir les satisfaire et voir sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Abla is a reseller of women’s and children’s underwear in a local market. She is a mother of three children aged 13, 11 and 6, all of whom are at school. She herself is 42 years of age, and is married to a silkscreen printer. 

Abla sells pretty undergarments to all kinds of people, and this is why she runs out of stock every time she buys new supplies. Her customer base is becoming increasingly large, and she has therefore requested a second loan from this institution to buy supplies of merchandise. She would like to increase her stock with all the latest models possible, so that she can provide for her family and get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy women’s and children’s underwear.

loans.name: Sumah

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Sumah. He is married and has no children.

In 2009, Sumah established his business selling drinks of various brands. He began his business because he wanted to generate more income from development. 

Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month as profit from this business. 

He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Sumah requires this loan as working capital. In the future, Sumah plans to be an importer of different types of drinks to be sold to retailers.   

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Dionisia;la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de carpinteria ,la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo ,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia,la socia realiza camas, armarios, roperos, entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de madera al por mayor.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member's name is Dionisia. She is still working in the carpentery business. She works with her husband and this is how she gets her family ahead. She has done this business for years and it is going well for her, thanks to the hard work she brings to it every day. She makes beds, dressers, wardropes, and more. She is a responsible and hardworking person who really wants to keep working for her family. 

She is asking for the loan to buy wood wholesale. 

She is thankful for the support that will be given to her and she is comitted to making her payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es: El señor Yuri pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK” de la Asociación Arariwa, Yuri vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, tiene 67 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos, él se dedica a la confección de disfraces y tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio, él hace diferentes disfraces de danzas típicas de la región del Cusco como por ejemplo “Capac Colla”, “Chuchacha” y otros más.  El señor Yuri en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de confección como por ejemplo, telas, encajes, botones, hilos, agujas, lentejuelas y otras cosas más.
texts.en: Yuri belongs to the “MINIBANK” communal banks of the Asociación Arariwa.  Yuri lives in the beautiful city of Cuzco. He is 67 years old, married and has five children. He works making costumes and has a small workshop in his home. He makes different costumes for traditional dances of the Cuzco region, such as the “Capac Colla”, the “Chuchacha” and more. Yuri requires the loan at this time to buy sewing materials such as fabrics, lace, buttons, thread, needles, sequins and more.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as fabrics, lace, buttons, thread, needles, sequins and more.

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.en:
Firdavs is 18 years old. He is a very clever boy and graduated school with excellence and good marks. He was one of the best pupils of his school. He likes math, computers, geography and other subjects. His classmates like him very much. 

This year he entered the Economic University, in the faculty of Economics. His parents are teachers. Their income is too low to pay for Firdavs’s study at the university. Firdavas wants to be one of the best economists in his town. He is purposeful and hardworking. 

Please, help him to realize his dream. He is asking for a loan of 1150 USD to pay for his studies at university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for his studies at university

loans.name: Daramy

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Daramy. He is married and has one child, aged 12 years old. He has one additional dependent living with him.  

In 2007, Daramy established his tailoring business. He began his business because he wanted to improve himself and his family. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Daramy requires this loan for him to buy an industrial tailoring machine, which produces different tailoring designs. This will increase his number of customers, which will eventually increase his profit.  

In the future, Daramy plans to establish a tailoring school to train youths in tailoring. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for a tailoring machine

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Salamatu. She is married and has three children aged 18, 16 and 13. 

In 1999, Salamatu established her rubbers, clothes, slippers, jeans and jewelry business. She began her business because she wanted to generate income, educate her children and build houses. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of Le 4,500,000. Salamatu requires a loan for her to travel to neighboring countries in order to buy large quantities of clothing, rubber, slippers and jeans at discount prices.  

In the future, Salamatu plans to import goods into the country and establish a business in a different part of the country. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing, rubber, slippers and jeans

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Angelie provides habal-habal or motorcycle services, with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Angelie has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Angelie hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.es: Geronimo, es una persona de 48 años de edad de estado civil casado, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, cuenta con dos dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus pequeños hijos, vive en su domicilio propio que se halla situado en el barrio K'ochi de la población de Punata y su actividad económica es de brindar sus servicios de mano de obra con una antigüedad de dos años en una granja privada de ganados bovinos lecheros de la misma población por el cual genera una remuneración salarial mensual. Finalmente el cliente y su esposa manifiestan tener el deseo de poder superarse y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la adquisición de una accesión de riego agrícola con el cual pretenden realizar algunas siembras de hortalizas en los terrenos aledaños a su vivienda y de tal forma obtener algunos ingresos económicos adicionales que vayan a mejorar la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en: Geronimo is a 48 year old man. He is married and has a primary school education. He has financial dependents, which are his small children. He lives in his own home located in the K'ochi neighborhood in the community of Punata. His present finciacial activity is working as a laborer. He has worked for two years in a private dairy cattle farm in the same town, which earns him a monthly salary. The client and his wife have manifested a desire to be able to get ahead and to that effect the need to ask for investment capital to acquire an irrigation system. They intend to plant vegetables on land near their home and this way obtain some additional income to improve the quality of life for their dependents.

loans.use: to buy an agricultural irrigation system.

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en:
Sopheak is a married mother of two and aged 34. Both of her daughters are staying with the family. 

To support the family, Sopheak and her husband have been making Cambodian rice cake for sale for around ten years. One of the constraints for them is a lack of working capital to run the business. As a result, during their spare time, they work for others to earn additional income.  

Sopheak is not new to VisionFund, as she's been with this KIVA's partner for five loan cycles and has completely repaid all her credit obligations. Given her good characteristics and repayment behavior, Sopheak was appointed the leader of her sixth loan group with VisionFund. As the leader, Sopheak will use her portion to buy ingredients for her business, such as flour, sugar, banana leaves and so on. 

Through this loan, she hopes to be able to make more cakes an therefore generate more income to support her family better.

loans.use: To buy flour and other ingredients needed to make Cambodian rice cake

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a 40-year-old woman, who lives in the city of Mombasa with her four children whom she loves and who are her biggest reason to get ahead. 

She is a very humble, hard-working and enthusiastic person, who has great motivation to overcome anything. With great effort and enthusiasm, day by day, Mesalimu works in her cafe selling a variety of dishes and beverages. She spends about 12 hours a day in her business and thinks that it is going well because she treats her customers well and with respect.

Mesalimu is very thankful for the help given to her. She is taking out this loan to purchase sugar, wheat flour and cooking oil. Little by little she hopes to achieve her great dream of seeing her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Deborah De Samarie 1, 2, 4 & 5 Group

texts.fr:
Erno est le coordinateur de son groupe Deborah de Samarie. Il habite dans la région de CAP-H d’Haïti  où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Erno a dirigée se commerce de divers Produits pendant les 3 années. Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à plus que des chaussures, accessoires pour femmes et homme, vêtements, etc.

Erno espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à ouvrir une grande Boutique parce que maintenant il vendre ses Produits dans la marche. Des autres membres Deborah ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces vendre des produits Alimentaires, chaussures, et charbon. Erno dit que sa rêve est de gagner plus argents pour que il achète plus des produits moins chers et d’une meilleure qualité.
texts.en:
Erno is the coordinator of the "Deborah de Samarie 1, 2, 4 & 5" group. He lives in Haïti's CAP-H region, where electricity is rare and water supplies are very limited. Erno has run a business selling various products for 3 years. He would like to use this loan to restock on items like shoes, accessories for women and men, and clothing.

Erno hopes that this loan will help him to open a large shop, because he is currently selling his goods at the market.
The other members of the "Deborah de Samarie 1, 2, 4 & 5" group need the loan for their own businesses, selling products like food, shoes and charcoal. Erno says that his dream is to earn more money so that he is in a position to buy higher quality products in larger amounts for a cheaper price.

loans.use: to buy various products.

loans.name: Divine Group

texts.fr: «DIVINE» est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe du nom de Francine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 30 ans. Francine a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Francine est mariée à un transitaire du nom de Romuald. Le couple a un enfant à charge qui n’est pas leur propre enfant. Francine vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Francine assure ensemble avec son mari, les diverses charges du foyer. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Francine mène comme activité, la coiffure dans un quartier du Bénin. Secondairement à cette activité, Francine vend des mèches, des tissus et des savons. Francine exerce cette activité depuis six ans et s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profits, Francine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe «DIVINE» un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Divine is a group with three female members who are all friends. The group’s representative is called Francine (pictured with her hand raised in the photo), and she is 30 years of age. She left school during her elementary education. 

Francine is married to a forwarding agent called Romuald. The couple has one child under their care, although this is not their own child. Together with her husband, Francine ensures that the various household expenses are met. To cover these expenses, she works as a hairdresser in a neighborhood of Benin. In addition to this business, she also sells hair extensions, fabrics and soap. Francine has been working in this area for six years, and gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

To better meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base, and to make more profits, Francine has requested a fourth loan from Alidé along with the other members of the Divine group. Their first loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and fabrics.

loans.name: Jampier Antonio

texts.es:
Jampier es un joven de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, a pesar de será tan joven él es una personas muy amable, trabajar y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven para solventar sus gastos y apoyar a su Abuela con los gastos del hogar, no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero sueña con poder hacerlo muy pronto, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su Abuela, a quien quiere mucho y agradece todo su apoyo y consejos brindados.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Jampier trabaja como obrero operario en una empresa agroexportadora de su ciudad, todas las mañanas desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, él puede laborar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jampier se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar los acabados de su dormitorio, él desea poder hacer el tarrajeo, pintado y puesta de ventanas de su habitación; de esta manera él podrá contar con una habitación adecuada y en buenas condiciones, que brinden mayor seguridad y bienestar, así él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y así seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Jampier is a young man of 20. He is single and lives in the city of Ica. In spite of being so young, he is a very likable, hard-working and enthusiastic person, with a great desire to get ahead in life. Unfortunately, due to the need to work since he was very young to pay his expenses and help his grandmother with the household expenses, he was not able to study for a profession. However, he dreams of being able to do so very soon. In his free time, he likes to share pleasant moments with his grandmother, whom he loves very much, and to whom he is grateful for all of her support and the advice she has given him. 

On his own initiative, with great dedication and enthusiasm, Jampier works each day as an operating worker for an agricultural export company in his city. Every morning he starts his work at an early hour, working about 12 hours. He believes it is going well for him thanks to his good performance and the friendly way he treats those around him. 

Jampier is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help provided to him, he will be able to complete work on his bedroom. He would like to carry out the plastering and painting and install the windows in his room. In this way he will be able to have a decent room in good condition, which will provide him with better security and well-being. He will continue working and putting forth effort to get ahead, and thus keep helping his family.

loans.use: to finish his bedroom.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Ms. Naseem is a married woman doing a business of hand embroidery with her husband, Muhammad Aslam. They are happy doing this together. Her husband has a good knowledge of making designs. The demands of their patterns are increasing day by day. They have three daughters. They are striving hard to cover their expenses including food, clothing, and quality education. In order to expand their business, Ms. Naseem has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy raw material including cloth, colorful threads, beads, etc. This would help them to make larger profits and better support their family.

loans.use: To buy raw material including cloth, colorful threads, beads, etc.

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.en: A beautiful woman by the name of Gulijahon lives in a house, which has a bad condition. She is a divorcee and has a daughter. Her daughter wants to live in the house that has a good condition, but her income from her job is not enough for it. She is an insurance specialist. She must repair the roof of her house. When it rains the roof of her house can’t withstand it. Gulijahon and her family are afraid of the cold and wind. She is asking for a loan of 12,000 Somoni  to repair her house. In this way, she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. Each month, she will make her payment on time. She awaits your support and mercy. Please, help her and her family if it is possible.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as wood and cement for repairing the house.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia Josefina, La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de cerveza,la socia tiene un deposito donde vende la cerveza, a la vez tambien sigue dedicandose al negocio de restaurante,la socia ofrece desayunos,almuerzo y cena,la socia lleva años dedicandose a sus negocios los cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia,la socia es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia,la socia es una personsa responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de cerveza al por mayor.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This borrower, Josefina, continues to dedicate herself to her business selling beer. She has a depot where she sells the beer. At the same time, she is also continuing to operate her restaurant business, where she offers breakfast, lunch and dinner. She has operated her businesses for years now, and they are going well for her thanks to the dedication she puts into them every day. The borrower is a responsible person with a great desire to continue working for her family. She is a responsable and hard-working person, and because of this she is helping her family get ahead. 

The borrower is requesting the loan to buy beer on a wholesale basis. 

The borrower is grateful for the help that will be provided to her, and accordingly she is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy beer on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Scovia's Group

texts.en:
Scovia's group is comprised of two hard working women. Scovia is 23-years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Scovia has been working hard to manage her small business where she sells household goods and basic foods. 

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy goods like soap and bread to sell. This will help Scovia to generate greater profits and help pay school fees for her child. Scovia hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot and build a home. 

Scovia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and serves as a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy goods like soap and bread to sell.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Ms. Nazeeran is a married woman and enjoys making parandas and has done so for so many years. Paranda is considered to be a traditional hair accessory in a country like Pakistan. Girls use it for a traditional look on special occasions like on Eid and for weddings. She makes beautiful paranda especially for bridal hairstyles. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation.

She is striving hard to meet her family expenditures. She is responsible for providing them with a good environment with good food, clothing and education. She needs a loan of Rs, 20,000 to buy raw material including colorful threads, beads, mirrors, and pearls for the hair style embellishment. This will enable her to meet the increasing demand of her parandas, and she can earn a better income to support her family well.

loans.use: To buy raw material including colorful threads, beads, mirrors, and pearls for hair style embellishment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy agricultural products to resell for profits.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”;  La socia es Catalina, la socia tiene 42 años de edad, la socia es viuda y tiene 02 hijos ,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia siembra lo que son papa y maiz,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia también vende su mercadería en las ferias de los días viernes en el distrito de Anta, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra fertilizantes y abono para su chacra.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Catalina belongs to the “Mujeres En Acción” communal bank.  Catalina is a 42 year old widow, and she has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with farming.  She grows potatoes and corn, and she has been in this business for years.  It is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business.  

She sells her merchandise to her customers who request it.  She also sells her merchandise on Fridays at the fairs in the Anta district.  She is a responsible and diligent person.  By being this way she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer and manure for her farm.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish in a very large quantity

loans.name: Maria Cipriana

texts.es:
La señora Maria Cipriana esta casada, tiene 50 años de edad, cursó sus estudios de educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de gabachas y delantales típicos, lleva 21 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas de varios diseño y colores, como también hilos, para aumentar su producción de gabachas y delantales típicos, ya que espera extender el negocio a sus hijos, para tener una buena condición de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Cipriana is 50 years old, and she is married.  She has an elementary school education.  She has two children who go to school.  She makes and sells traditional smocks and aprons, and she has 21 years of experience.  She has financial support from her husband.

She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy fabrics with various designs and colors.  She will also buy thread in order to increase her production of traditional smocks and aprons.  She will do this because she wants to open her business to her children in order to have good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Yon's Group

texts.en:
Yon, aged 44, is a widowed mother of three, one of whom is dependent on her and under school age. Yon and the family live in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. Selling fish and chicken meat is the main source of her family's income, which she has been in this kind of business for twenty years. 

This is Yon's second loan with VisionFund. She was appointed to be the group leader for a group loan of two women members. Yon successfully paid back her first loan to VisionFund and this first loan has enabled her to buy more quantity of fish and chicken meats for sale. Through the second loan, Yon hopes to expand her business and to generate more income so that she can set aside some savings for her daughter to enter school when her school age arrives.

loans.use: To buy more fish and chicken meat for sale

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa has three children, one of whom attends school; she is a young entrepreneur and she keeps on running her beauty salon, which has notably grown; on top of this she now runs a cosmetic shop as well. Thanks to these two activities she has succeeded in providing for her children. On this occasion Mwanahawa will invest the loan she has requested in the purchase of cosmetics and other beauty products and chemicals.

Mwanahawa works very hard and she makes sacrifices because she wants to see her children attend university, and it is for them she is making all these sacrifices.

She is deeply grateful to KIVA for allowing her to offer a better standard of living to her family and a better education to her children, and for helping her in strengthening her activities and in making them grow.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and other beauty products and chemicals.

loans.name: Goreti's Group

texts.en:
Goreti's group is comprised of 3 hard-working women. Goreti is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 6 months, Goreti has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells second-hand clothes. 

To help expand her business, Goreti has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand her range of used clothing to sell and will help Goreti to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Goreti hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Goreti is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to expand her assortment of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Mr. Batsaihan is 47 years old and lives with his wife in Uvurhangai city, Mongolia. In 2009, Batsaihan started to sell raw materials, meat, and organic dairy products from the countryside at Ulaanbaatar market. He is transporting these goods by his own mini-truck. In summer he usually delivers organic dairy products and in winter time he transports meat. Also he is operating a road repair business. He has a power shovel. 

Batsaihan's mini-truck is getting old, so he would like to repair his truck to transport his organic dairy products. Therefore he is requesting a 3,800,000 MNT loan to buy  spare parts for the mini-truck. He is a kind man who says, "We are planing to build a house with the profits we earn."

loans.use: To buy  spare parts for the mini-truck to transport his organic dairy products

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of goods, such as food and beverages, to stock in her store.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida  is an energetic married woman who has been running her own general store for the past five years. She offers various items in her store including bread, butter, eggs, milk, cold drinks, shampoo, cleaning products, etc.

She has four daughters. She is accountable to arrange their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. She has improved her business with the support of the Kashf foundation. 

Now she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy additional items including rice, sugar and other grocery items in bulk from markets. She then would be able to manage increasing demand efficiently and hence improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy additional items including rice, sugar and other grocery items.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Ms. Azra is a very hardworking lady. She has been working with Kashf for last eight years. She has 3 buffalos and 2 cows. She does the business of milk and cattle selling, too. She purchases calves, grows them with care and then sells them when they are grown up. She earns a good profit from this business.

According to baji Azra, before starting business on her own, their family situation was very bad. Her husband was the single earner of the family. Seeing that situation, baji Azra decided to help her family, and she took a loan and started this business. Now she needs 30,000 PKR for buying calves.

Now she has a happy family life as she is providing at least the compulsory required things for her family, and she is very happy that she now has the ability to make decisions and is playing a great role in her family responsibilities.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Tasneem

texts.en:
Ms. Tasneem is a married woman and has been running her own beauty parlor for the last 10 years. She is doing her job keenly; she knows the techniques of make-up and hair designs and facilitates her customers on special occasions like weddings. She is a well known and famous beautician in her town.

She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is not in a good physical shape to be employed, so she is working hard to fulfill their day-to-day expenses. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy more beauty products for her parlor including lotions, cleansers, make-up kits, lightening creams, etc. so that she would be able to cater to large numbers of customers efficiently.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her parlor including lotions, cleansers, make-up kits, lightening creams, etc.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Mrs. Rukhsana is a married woman who lives in a small town; she has just started business with Kashf. She runs a stitching business at her home. When she got married, she saw that her husband was the only earner of the family, so she decided to help her husband. 

Firstly, she started this work with her own savings, and with the growth of the business, she faced the problem of cash flow. Her neighbor guided her to take financing from Kashf. So she requested a loan of 10,000 Pakistan rupees (Rs.) from Kashf for buying a sewing machine and some related material. That move helped her a lot, and now she is very hopeful that she can cater to the demands of her clients and can help her husband in meeting the expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and some related material.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Amie.  She is married and has three children aged 25, 20, and 18.  She has one additional dependent. In 2004, Amie established her charcoal business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in running the home. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le500,000 as profit  every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. 

Amie now requires a  loan in order to buy a large  stock of charcoal and increase her profit. In the future, Amie plans to erect another house with her husband.   She thanks  you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 31 years old, married to Peter, and  blessed with three children aged nine, six and three years old.  She runs a retail shop, a business she started four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She has requested a third loan of KES. 60,000 to purchase five crates of sodas, juices, bales of flour and Pampers.  


The profit she earns will aid her to educate her children. Her dream is to see her business expand and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase five crates of sodas, juices, bales of flour and Pampers.

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine's group is comprised of 2 hard-working women. Justine is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Justine has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fresh foods like Irish potatoes and tomatoes. 

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more vegetables like carrots and eggplant to sell and will help Justine to generate greater profits and pay her child's school fees. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build on it. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables like carrots and eggplant to sell

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 34 years old. She is married to Charles and together they have four children, age 16, 10, 6 and 2 years.

She has been in the retail business for five years and earns a monthly income of KES 5,000. The loan will be used to purchase stock such as sugar, flour, and soap.The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. Her hopes and dreams are to to have a prosperous business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, and washing detergent for sale.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
Alisher is 29 years old. He is not married yet. He lives with parents and always wanted to provide a good quality of life for them. It’s for this reason that he one year ago began his own business with driving. Thanks to his good service, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improved. 

His house is in bad condition. He must repair the roof of his house and then change the gate. He is asking for a loan to buy building materials such as wood for repairing the house. In this way his living condition will be better. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as wood for repairing his house.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a married woman. She has two cows, one buffalo and six sheep. She has been working with Kashf for seven years and always used her loan in productive businesses. 

She started this business by selling and purchasing goats and sheep. Gradually, she purchased cows and buffaloes too. Now she is running a successful business of milk production and cattle sales. 

She has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy calves. She has a very strong credit history and she always believes that hard work is the key factor of her success. She always advises others to use their loans in productive manners to do good for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong is a 30-year-old married woman with two children, a son and a daughter. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Phuong lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She has run a business of selling sugarcane juice for seven years. She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by repairing the stand from which she sells sugarcane juice and by purchasing glasses to better serve her customers. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her sugarcane juice stand and to purchase glasses

loans.name: Vany's Group

texts.en:
Aged 53, Vany has six children living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Battambang province.

To support the family, Vany does rice farming while her husband is a beehive hunter. Apart from the two mentioned businesses, they also raise pigs for sale to make more income. From these businesses, they are able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day. Her farming business struggles when there is a natural disaster like drought or flood.

Vany is new to VisionFund while her other three group members have been with this Kiva partner for many loan cycles. Because of her good characteristics, Vany was appointed to be a group leader. Vany will use her portion to spend on farmland preparation, to buy more piglets and pig feed.

Vany hopes this loan will help her to grow more rice with good yield and that the pigs will grow healthily so that she can sell them for a higher price and in turn allow her to help the children with their school fees.

loans.use: to spend on farmland preparation, to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Phat is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and range of SIM cards and mobile cards from different suppliers to satisfy her customers. Phat's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and range of SIM cards and mobile cards.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru runs a vegetable stall in Ruwiya village, Likoni, Kenya. She started this business because she saw there was need for such business in the area. She manages and looks after the business herself every day from very early in the morning. She sells essential items since she needs to ensure she makes sales. She sells, amongst other things, cabbages, tomatoes and onions.

She is married with three school-attending children, who are her most important reason to continue fighting to get ahead. With the loan, she will buy products such as tomatoes, oranges, onions, cabbages, etc., to supply her business so that she can feel more secure, and in this way, she will be able to sell more and cover her costs and the loan.

loans.use: to buy products such as tomatoes, oranges, onions, cabbages, etc.

loans.name: Sugar

texts.en:
Sugar is 59 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger in Uvurkhangai province, Mongolia. He started a freight transportation business in 2007.  He is well-experienced and popular in the town. He is an honest and hardworking person.
 
His wife, Nyamsuren, is 59 years old. She is a pensioner. His son, Nergui, is 24 years old. He works in a company.

His son is getting married soon. Therefore, Sugar needs 2,500,000 MNT to purchase a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent, for his son.

loans.use: To purchase a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent, for his son.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is requesting a new loan to buy furniture for her food stall and good quality food for selling and to repair her family's motorcycle. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers and provide her family with a means of transport. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture and food to expand her business and for motorcycle repairs.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is requesting a new loan to buy furniture, glasses and cups to expand her business. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her coffee shop and increasing sales and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture, glasses and cups to expand her business.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of basic goods such as rice, soft drinks, milk and sugar to stock her general store and sell from her food stall.

loans.name: Khai

texts.en: Khai is requesting a new loan to buy many kinds of goods, such as soft drinks and confectionery, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of goods, such as soft drinks and confectionery

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine's group is composed of three hardworking women. Christine is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Christine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells household goods. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy goods like soap and bread to sell, and it will help Christine to generate greater profits, pay medical expenses and save and budget. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy goods like soap and bread to sell.

loans.name: Batmabubu

texts.ru:
Батмабубу 49 лет, замужем, имеет 6 детей, младшая из которых школьница. Батмабубу в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 10 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Батмабубу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется дойная корова с приплодом, 15 овец, 3 козы, 1 лошадь, продажа молока приносит около 5,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Батмабубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов мелкого скота.  Доходы от кредита Батмабубу планирует вложить в ремонт дома для своей семьи и оплату контракта для средней дочери - студентки.
texts.en:
Batmabubu is 49 years old and married, with six children.  Her youngest daughter is still in secondary school. As a main source of income for her family, Batmabubu has been raising livestock for 10 years, having launched this business with the sum of 2,000 KGS. Thanks to Batmabubu’s hard work, her farm today includes a dairy cow with calves, 15 sheep, three goats and one horse; milk sales bring in about 5,000 KGS per month. 

In order to develop her business further, Batmabubu has turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy additional heads of small livestock. Batmabubu plans to use the resulting revenues  for  repairs of the family home and tuition costs for her middle daughter, a college student.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Pamela Karen

texts.es:
Pamela es una mujer de 23 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su Madrina, quien siempre ha estado a su lado apoyándola y ha sido como una madre para ella; Pamela es una joven muy alegre, entusiasta y trabajadora, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y con mucho empeño se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de Enfermería, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, desde hace 3 años Pamela puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella vende prendas tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Pamela se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como: pantalones, buzos, polos, chompas, casacas, entre otras prendas; de esta manera Pamela tendrá su negocio mejor abastico, con ello espera poder incrementar su ventas e ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poco a poco poder ampliar su negocio, así ella seguirá esforzándose y trabajando para convertirse en una buena profesional y en una mujer de bien.
texts.en:
Pamela is a 23 year-old single woman who lives in the city of Ica with her godmother, who has always been by her side supporting her, and who has been like a mother to her.
