Pamela is a very happy, enthusiastic and hardworking young woman who has a great desire to succeed. Thanks to her efforts and great determination she is studying the technical profession of nursing. She enjoys spending her spare time with her family.

Three years ago Pamela enthusiastically started her small business selling clothing. She starts work every day early in the morning selling garments for gentlemen, ladies and children. She dedicates approximately 10 hours a day to her business and believes it is going well because of her dedication and her friendly service to her customers.

Pamela is very grateful to Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she will be able to purchase merchandise for her business, such as pants, track suits, polo shirts, sweaters and jackets among other items. Thus her business will be better stocked and she expects to be able to increase her sales and income. This will enable her to gradually expand her business and she will continue striving and working to become a good woman and a good professional.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business, such as pants, track suits, polo shirts, sweaters, jackets, etc.

loans.name: Mahoutin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUTIN est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sylvie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sylvie est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un certain Aimé. Sylvie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Parmi, les enfants, quatre sont leurs propres enfants. Sylvie vit seule avec ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Sylvie vend depuis une dizaine d’années, des condiments à son domicile. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Sylvie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sylvie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUTIN, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The MAHOUTIN group has three members who live in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that this group is seeking financial support from the microfinance institution ALIDé, to raise the level of their business activities. Sylvie is the leader of the group and is raising her hand in the photo. Sylvie is 30 years old and is married to Aimé. Sylvie did not go to school. The couple has five children who are all in their care. Some of the children are in school. Four of the five children are their own children. Sylvie lives alone with her children. The couple take care of all the various household needs. To contribute to the different needs of the family, for around ten years, Sylvie has been selling condiments from her home. This activity allows her to meet her needs without difficulty. Sylvie gets her supplies from a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and increase her turnover and income, Sylvie, together with the other members of the MAHOUTIN group is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The previous loan has been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Zonia,la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de restaurante ,la socia ofrece desayunos,almuerzos y cenas ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,la socia trabaja desde las 09:00am hasta las 08:00pm aproximadamente,a la vez la socia tambien continua con su negocio de compra y venta de antiguedades,la socia es una personsa responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos para su negocio como aceite y arroz.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member is Sra. Zonia. She continues dedicating herself to her restaurant business where she offers breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  The member has spent years in this business, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it. She works from 9 a.m. until approximately 8 p. m. At the same time, she is also continuing with her business buying and selling antiques.

The member is a responsible and hardworking woman and this has enabled her to move her family ahead.

The member is requesting the loan to buy supplies for her restaurant business, such as oil and rice.

The member is grateful for the support being provided to her and promises to make all of her payments on time in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her business such as oil and rice.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is a 55-year-old, married woman who lives in the city of Ho Chi Minh. She has two children. She and her husband earn an income to support their family by running a photography business. They are both photographers. 

Thuy plans to use this loan to buy another camera and repair her lab room so that she can provide better services to her customers and increase the capacity of her business. Thuy hopes that through this loan she will be able to increase her income and better support her children.

loans.use: To buy a camera and repair her photo lab.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Mrs. Jamila lives in the village of Arrian; this is her second loan. She does embroidery by hand. According to Jamila, before taking a loan from the Kashf foundation their household situation was not very good, but when she started her own work and began to help her family, her family situation became much better. 

She started this business at a very low level; she used to deliver her handmade products only within the village on occasion, but now she has established contacts with shopkeepers. To complete her current orders she needs pearls, thread, needles, etc. For this purpose she requested Kashf to provide a loan of 15,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR). 

She has a strong motive to enhance the living standards of her family and provide a good education and health facilities for them.

loans.use: To buy pearls, thread, needles etc.

loans.name: Rafimes' Group

texts.en:
Rafimes, age 36, is originally from the district of Dambae in the Kampong Cham province. She lives with three daughters, all of whom are paid workers. 

Rafimes has one hectare of farmland where she grows cassava. She has been involved in this type of work for 10 years and earns about 18,000 KHR. 

This is the first loan for Rafimes and her fellow group member. Both of them are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Rafimes will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and grocery items for resale for additional income. She hopes to earn more income from her current businesses so as to earn a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Otgonbayar is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a small house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband's name is Bayanbaigal; he has worked as a teacher at a secondary school for 30 years. Two of Mrs. Otgonbayar's children are university students and her younger son goes to a secondary school. 

Mrs. Otgonbayar started her own cashmere products trading business in 2010. She rents a stall at the local market. In the future, she is planning to build her own cashmere product trading store for her business. She is requesting 800,000 MNT to pay for her daughter's tuition fees. Otgonbayar is an ethical and punctual woman.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Mahuna Group

texts.fr: MAHUNA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Sehoue Enagnon Loïse (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Sehoue Enagnon Loïse vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Sehoue Enagnon Loïse assure avec son mari, les diverses charges de la maison. Depuis près de neuf ans, Sehoue Enagnon Loïse vend des vêtements qu'elle confectionne dans son atelier. Sehoue Enagnon Loïse s’approvisionne en tissus et en matériels de couture dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la septième fois que Sehoue Enagnon Loïse et les autres membres du groupe MAHUNA sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus précédemment ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The MAHUNA group has three members who live in the same neighborhood. Sehoue Enagnon Loïse is the leader of the group and is raising her hand in the photo. She is 30 years old and is married to Jean. The couple has one child who is in their care and attends school. Sehoue Enagnon Loïse lives together with her husband and her children. Sehoue Enagnon Loïse and her husband take care of the various household expenses. For almost nine years, Sehoue Enagnon Loïse has been selling clothes that she makes in her workshop. Sehoue Enagnon Loïse gets her sewing materials and fabric supplies from a market in Benin. This is the seventh time that Sehoue Enagnon Loïse and the other members of the MAHUNA group are seeking financial support from the microfinance institution ALIDé in order to strengthen their working capital and their businesses and to better respond to the needs of their customers. The previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing materials.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam is married and has one child. He sells shoes to earn a living. He has been in this business for five years. Through the financial support from Imon International, he has managed to grow his business. He dreams of expanding his business and becoming prosperous in the future.

Rustam needs a loan of 5000 TJS to buy a variety of shoes so her can offer a better assortment. He is grateful for your help.

loans.use: To buy a variety of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch, 39, is a married mother of two from a village in Moung Russey, Battambang province. Her two sons are still in school. Touch and her husband earn a living through farming rice on five hectares of land and have earned additional income by growing sesame seeds and beans for several years. The current business earns them approximately 30,000 Riel (KHR) per day. 

This is the second loan for Touch's group with VisionFund. The first loan has enabled Touch to better feed her family as more income was generated. This time Touch was voted to be the group leader. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her crops and will use the remaining amount to prepare the land. Touch strongly hopes this second loan will allow her to get a good yield of crops and hence sell the rice for good money, enabling her to expand her business.

loans.use: To prepare her farmland and to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Heap's Group

texts.en:
Aged 40, Heap is a father of five dependent children who are still in school. He manages one hectare of farmland for growing cassava as his main income source, supplementing his income by selling chickens and fish. He has had these businesses for ten years, earning about 26,000 Riel (KHR) per day. Heap has been with VisionFund for three loans and has paid them back successfully. The past loans have helped him to stabilize his living conditions. 

Now, he has formed a group of two to seek a new loan. He is applying for 1,400,000 KHR and  the other group member is seeking 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, he will use his portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee for his farmland. He hopes to double his income so as to maintain a good standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee for his farmland

loans.name: Laurent

texts.en:
Laurent aged 45.  He is married to a farmer and they both have eight children between the ages of 8 and 26.  Only four of them attend school.  He has requested a loan for use in the support of labor costs.  He has been farming for six years.  The profits from the business will be used to pay for medical insurance and to pay school fees for the children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan is a 62-year-old married woman with two children, a son and a daughter.  Her husband works as a driver for hire.  Phan lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City.  She has run a business of selling fruits for twenty years. 

She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing a greater quantity and quality of fruits, such as mangoes and papayas at wholesale prices to better serve her customers.  She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: To buy fruits, such as mangoes and papayas to sell

loans.name: Nonvignon Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Agbalè Pascaline (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un certain Ambroise. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Agbalè Pascaline vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de cinq ans, Agbalè Pascaline vend des bouteilles vides dans un marché du Bénin. Agbalè Pascaline s’approvisionne auprès de certains ménages dans une ville du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Agbalè Pascaline et les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The NONVIGNON group has four members who live in the same neighborhood. Agbalè Pascaline is the leader of the group and is raising her hand in the photo. She is 39 years old and is married to Ambroise. The couple have four childre, who are all in their care and in school. Agbalè Pascaline lives together with her husband and her children and together with her husband takes care of the various household expenses. For almost five years, Agbalè Pascaline has been selling empty bottles in a market in Benin. Agbalè Pascaline gets her supplies from certain households in city in Benin. This is the first time that Agbalè Pascaline and the other members of the NONVIGNON group are seeking financial support from the microfinance institution ALIDé in order to strengthen their working capital and their businesses in order to better respond to the needs of their customers.

loans.use: to buy empty bottles.

loans.name: Enrique Javier

texts.es: Enrique vive en el sector del Fortín norte de Guayaquil donde tiene su taller de radiadores. Empezó aprendiendo el negocio trabajando como ayudante de su hermano quien tenía un local en el centro de la ciudad, le va muy bien sobre todo por la ubicación. Después de un tiempo decidió hacer un préstamo para emprender su propio negocio decisión de la cual no se arrepiente ya que tiene varios años y es muy conocido. Actualmente continúa trabajando con su hermano pero de una manea diferente ya que lo hace como socio. El atiende desde muy temprano ya que en eso consiste su éxito. Este préstamo que está solicitando es para la comprar de materiales para las reparaciones como radio ventilador, radiadores, refrigerantes etc., con el tiempo desea incrementar su negocio porque su sueño es poder comprar una casa ya que la actual es alquilada y desea darle una estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en: Enrique lives in the Fortín sector, north of Guayaquil, where he has a radiator shop.  He started learning about this business while working as a helper for his brother, who had a shop in the city center.  Things are going well for him because of the location.  After some time he decided to ask for a loan so that he could start his own business, a decision that he has no regrets over, as he has been working for several years and is very well known.  Currently he continues to work with his brother, but in a different capacity because he works as a partner.  He begins working very early and he is successful because of that.  He will use the money from this loan to buy repair supplies such as radiator fans, radiators, refrigerants, etc.  He wants to grow his business over time because his dream is to buy a house.  He rents his current home and he wants to provide stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Hen is a 35-year-old mother of three children, some of whom are still in school. Her entire family is living in a rural area located in the Bovel district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has two hectares of rice farm on which she is able to produce a rice crop twice per year. She and her husband have been in this business for seven years. 

This will be her fourth loan; the previous loans, which she has paid back, enabled her to sustain her business and improve her family's livelihood. Now, she is taking out a new loan with Kiva partner VisionFund for $500. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her rice field. She hopes to grow her cash-crop in a timely manner so as to reach a great standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Ulziinyam

texts.en:
Mrs. Ulziinyam is 48 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (tent) in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Her husband, Battsagaan, is 44 years old. He runs a taxi service. Her son, Batbaatar, is eight years old. He is a second grade school student. 

She started selling organic dairy products at a rental counter in 2005. In the beginning, her turnover capital was 50,000 Tugriks (MNT). Currently, her turnover capital increased and reached 3,000,000 MNT. She has improved her family life with the profits she earned. She is a hardworking and intelligent person. She needs 3,000,000 MNT to buy more organic dairy products from herders for her business.

loans.use: To buy more organic dairy products from herders for her business
